unnormalised: **Education Technology: Virtual Classrooms - Are They Here to Stay?**
normalised: education technology: virtual classrooms - are they here to stay?

unnormalised: Hey there, tech-savvy students! Virtual classrooms are becoming the new normal, aren't they? From Mumbai to Manipur, kids are ditching chalkboards for Chromebooks. Remember those long commutes to school? Gone! Now you can roll out of bed and be in class in minutes!
normalised: hey there, tech-savvy students! virtual classrooms are becoming the new normal, aren't they? from mumbai to manipur, kids are ditching chalkboards for chromebooks. remember those long commutes to school? gone! now you can roll out of bed and be in class in minutes!

unnormalised: Schools like DPS, R.K. Puram, and even smaller institutions in towns like Coimbatore are embracing the digital shift big time. It's not just about lectures either; think virtual field trips to the Taj Mahal and interactive lessons.

unnormalised: However, internet access is still a big issue for many, especially in rural areas. Getting everyone online is priority no. 1. But the potential is huge. Imagine celebrating Onam with classmates from all over India, even sharing virtual biryani recipes!
